title: Can I appeal an eviction judgement while my landlord is requesting a relief of stay in a bankruptcy court?
question: I filed bankruptcy and received a stay of eviction. We currently have a hearing schedule for 10/10 regarding the landlords motion for relief of stay. All of my rent is current and form 101B has been filed with the bankruptcy court. Can/should I still file to appeal the original eviction judgement with the local court?
answers: If were current on the rent, why did the judge rule against you? Did your lease expire? Yes you can appeal so long as it is timely. You can inform the bk judge of your appeal
